intro: Nuttallia gypsea, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low, sprawling growth habit with narrow, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Nuttallia gypsea is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh desert climates.
